body.p:
Whitley Cir Ct March term/64
To his Excelence of the govenor of the commonwealth of Kentucky

your petitioner John R Evans and L. Q. Barton Wold Respectifull Represent that some in the yeare 18643 that they ware keeping atavern in Londen Kentuckey and that they failed for a certain time to set up the Tavern Rates in ther Tavern house and that at the March Term of Said courte that they was indited for failing to set up the Rates in the tavern House and on said judgement inditement a Judgement Rendered against them for the Sum of seventy five dollars and that they did not know that they ware Required to set up said Rates in his tavern house and had no intention of violating the law and that they are Pore and has not the meanes to pay the debt ^fine^ and to do justice to the Remainder of ther familey
Wheare for they pay that your Excelence Remit the fine and set asid the Judgment and for all Proper Releaf
sworn to before me by J R L Q Barton this 24 day of January 1865
C L Creekmore p j w c

The under signed say that they are acquainted with the said Barton & Evans and say that they beleave it wold be an act of charity to Remit the fine and askes that the fine be Remitedd
John Smith
J. L McCarty
S. P. Browner
Joseph Boulton
L. P. Bird
James Siler
W. C. Finey
J. C. Watkins Clk
Whitley Circuit court
Tyrel Foley Clek
Whitely county court

Gov Bramlette I am satisfied that the within petitioners were Ignorant of the fact that they were violating law & think it right that the fine should be remitted & hope your Excellency will remit same

Whitley Cir Ct
vs
John R. Evans & L. T. Barton
$75 --
